Name: (C) IECC 2021 Walls & Air Sealing
Description: Commercial wall insulation and air sealing consistent with IECC 2021 energy code levels.
Energy Performance: AIA_CZ1:wall:25.32; AIA_CZ1:infiltration:0.33; AIA_CZ2:wall:22.97; AIA_CZ2:infiltration:0.33; AIA_CZ3:wall:20.60; AIA_CZ3:infiltration:0.33; AIA_CZ4:wall:18.43; AIA_CZ4:infiltration:0.33; AIA_CZ5:wall:16.82; AIA_CZ5:infiltration:0.33
Performance Source Notes: See ASHRAE to AIA climate zone conversions listed here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1XdnJQ5ujLBfvRvkJ117dxpMlLdbBCzYSMQ:Z7HK0:ec/edit#gid=1968005613
Performance Source Details:
ASHRAE Standard 90.1-2022, Section 5.4.3.1.1: Whole:Building Air Leakage; ASHRAE; 2022;55; NA
ANSI/ASHRAE/IES Standard 90.1-2022: Table 5.5:1 through Table 5.5:8 for Steel:framed walls; ASHRAE; 2022; 49, 50, 51, 52, 53, 54, 55, 56; NA
Cost Source Notes: Walls: Assume baseline wall cost from Scout data. Infiltration: Cost based on cost premium:per:% performance improvement implied by residential 'IECC : existing' air sealing measure. Using AIA CZ1 as a benchmark, the residential measure shows a cost premium of $0.42/ft^2 wall per 35% performance improvement in existing buildings in 2017; thus the cost premium to add to the baseline commercial infiltration cost of $0/ft^2 wall is $2.2/ft^2 wall in existing buildings ($0.42/ft^2 wall premium / 35% improvement)*(73% improvement for commercial infiltration in existing buildings in AIA CZ1 in 2017 (1 : 0.4/1.5)). New measure shows zero cost premium.
Cost Source Details: Scout Baseline Envelope Characteristics Database; U.S. Department of Energy, Office of Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy, Building Technologies Office; 2023; ; https://github.com/trynthink/scout/blob/master/scout/supporting_data/convert_data/cpl_envelope_mels.json
Lifetime Source Notes: Assumed equal to the lifetime of the building
